meanings.definition: The quality or state of being logical and consistent
meanings.sent1: The coherency of his argument made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her essay lacked coherency, jumping from one idea to another.
meanings.sent3: The coherency of the joke was lost on the young audience.
meanings.sent4: The coherency of the team's strategy was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The coherency of the puzzle's design made it satisfying to complete.

meanings.definition: The quality of forming a unified whole
meanings.sent1: The coherency of the painting's colors created a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent2: The coherency of the story's plot tied all loose ends together.
meanings.sent3: The coherency of the outfit's mismatched pieces was surprisingly stylish.
meanings.sent4: The coherency of the music and lyrics blended seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The coherency of the garden's layout gave it a peaceful feel.

meanings.definition: The act or state of sticking together in a logical way
meanings.sent1: The coherency of the instructions helped the students complete the task.
meanings.sent2: The coherency of the project plan ensured all steps were followed correctly.
meanings.sent3: The coherency of the traffic flow made the commute smoother.
meanings.sent4: The coherency of the building's structure withstood the earthquake.
meanings.sent5: The coherency of the argument's points made it convincing.
